meanings.definition: A flat affine subspace of dimension n-1 in an n-dimensional space.
meanings.sent1: The mathematician drew a hyperplane on the board to explain the concept of dimensions.
meanings.sent2: The hyperplane separated the space into two distinct regions.
meanings.sent3: The hyperplane threw a party and invited all the other subspaces to join in the fun.
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe of mathematics, the hyperplane stood out like a beacon of simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The students visualized the hyperplane as a giant, flat sheet floating in space.

meanings.definition: A subspace of dimension n-1 in an n-dimensional space that divides the space into two half spaces.
meanings.sent1: The hyperplane in the model separated the data points into two distinct groups.
meanings.sent2: The hyperplane in the equation helped solve the complex spatial problem.
meanings.sent3: At the geometry party, the hyperplane was the center of attention, dividing the room into two halves.
meanings.sent4: The hyperplane acted as a referee, ensuring fair play between the two opposing sides of the space.
meanings.sent5: The hyperplane sliced through the space like a sharp knife, creating clear boundaries.
